circumstances: Bernard Perkins, a lively 11-year-old, was reported missing from his home on Dundee Road, Arbroath. On the day of his disappearance, Bernard had plans to meet his friend, Donna Thomas, at the local skate park. He often spent hours there practicing tricks and enjoying the company of peers. Donna waited but Bernard never showed up. A concerned colleague of Bernardâ€™s guardian recalled a conversation where Bernard mentioned wanting to catch a movie later in the day at the nearby movie theater. Upon further investigation, none of the theater staff or visitors recalled seeing him there. The breakthrough came when someone remembered Bernard talking excitedly about meeting new friends at the skate park. This spurred a search leading to Bernard being traced in Dundee, safe but confused about the fuss his whereabouts caused. Police found him slightly disoriented yet unharmed, bringing relief to his guardian and friends.
q_3_explanation: Bernard is 11 years old and vulnerable due to his age.
q_17_explanation: Bernard's disappearance was atypical for his usual behavior patterns.
q_18_explanation: He intended to meet a friend, which provides a reason for the temporary absence.
q_20_explanation: He was intending to meet friends at the skate park which he did not complete.

circumstances: Bernard Perkins, an 11-year-old boy, was reported missing after he failed to return home from a visit to the library with his friend, Alexandra Myers, in Dundee. Bernard was supposed to meet his foster parent at their home in Arbroath but did not arrive as expected. Concern grew when Bernard's usual confidant, his friend Donna Thomas, admitted she hadn't heard from him since the library visit. Police investigations began at the library and expanded to nearby areas, including Turnberry Avenue and 16 Cleghorn Street, as clues suggested Bernard may have ventured into unfamiliar locations. He was eventually traced by police at East School Road in Dundee, unharmed.
q_3_explanation: He is vulnerable due to being 11 years old.
q_6_explanation: He may have problems in unfamiliar locations as a child.
q_17_explanation: His disappearance was unexpected based on normal behavior.
q_20_explanation: He intended to return home after visiting the library but did not.

circumstances: Bernard Perkins was reported missing from his home on Dundee Road, Arbroath. Bernard's foster family grew increasingly worried after learning he had been involved in criminal activity with peers, a behavior quite unusual for him. A day after his disappearance, one of Bernard's friends contacted Jean Owen, a colleague, indicating that Bernard might have headed towards the Minto Place area in Dundee. His bicycle was found abandoned near 6 Lownie Road, Forfar, suggesting he ventured there amidst his distress. Fortunately, Bernard was traced by the police after three days, safe but shaken, having taken refuge with a friend in Dundee to escape his troubling circumstances.
entities_pattern_types: involved in criminal activity,vehicle found abandoned

q_3_explanation: Bernard is only 12 years old, making him vulnerable in various situations.
q_5_explanation: Bernard has no known medical or mental health conditions reported.

q_20_explanation: He intended to escape from his current situation when last seen.

circumstances: Bernard Perkins was last seen leaving his home on Dundee Road, Arbroath. His vehicle was later found abandoned near 11 Panmure Terrace, Dundee. Bernard, dealing with a recent bereavement, failed to collect his medication. A concerned friend alerted authorities, leading to his safe location in Dundee days later.
